results.title: Birth of the soil
results.creator_credit: George E. Brewer Jnr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Earth”.
This film shows how nature produces life-giving topsoil from the basic raw materials of rock, air, and sunlight, by the processes of plant growth and decay and photosynthesis.

results.title: Birth of the red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Shows mating, the female kangaroo’s preparation for the birth of her young and birth itself. Explains the significance of the oestrous cycle and gestation period, egg fertilization, and the development of the embryo in the uterus. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.description: Shows mating, the female kangaroo’s preparation for the birth of her young and birth itself. Explains the significance of the oestrous cycle and gestation period, egg fertilization, and the development of the embryo in the uterus. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Birth of an oilfield
results.brief_description: Shows how an oil well is drilled and crude oil is brought up from the ground and started on its way to the refinery. While live action is used to show glimpses of a drilling crew at work animation reveals what is taking place below the surface of the ground. No credits available.

results.title: Birth of an island
results.brief_description: Shows the formation of the new volcanic island of Surtsey near Iceland, beginning as a submarine eruption and building up to a substantiasl lava shield of several square miles. Covers the changes in activity of the volcano and investigation by landing parties. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Birth of a new product
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
Many new products sink without a trace as soon as they are launched on the market. A case history of success and failure shows how the risks can be minimised. Part of a marketing series which highlights, in this film, the market research, the development of new products, advertising, selling and distribution.

results.title: Birth of a giant
results.brief_description: Shows the final preparations for the launching by Queen Elizabeth of the 100,000 ton tanker British Admiral, the largest ship yet built in Europe. No other credits available.

results.title: Birth and death of mountains
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, BFA Educational Media and Film Associates
results.brief_description: Shows the forces that wear down mountains and those that cause mountains to be formed. Uses drawings to demonstrate formations of fold mountains, new faultblock mountains and new dome mountains. Observes the mountain-flattening forces of glaciers, wind and water. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Birth (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part five of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In this programme, pregnancy, birth and attitudes of women in all five places are examined, with a side-long look at different superstitions which reveal some strange stories. The programme asks, “Do women in peasant countries give birth with less pain and effort? And if so, why?”
